get.description:
Retrieve a list of compatibility sessions.
Note that by default, all sessions, including finished ones are returned, with the oldest first.
Use the `filter[status]` parameter to filter the sessions by their status and `page[last]` parameter to retrieve the last N sessions.

parameters.name: page[before]
parameters.description: Retrieve the items before the given ID

schema.description: Retrieve the items before the given ID

parameters.name: page[after]
parameters.description: Retrieve the items after the given ID

schema.description: Retrieve the items after the given ID

parameters.name: page[first]
parameters.description: Retrieve the first N items

schema.description: Retrieve the first N items

parameters.name: page[last]
parameters.description: Retrieve the last N items

schema.description: Retrieve the last N items

parameters.name: filter[user]
parameters.description: Retrieve the items for the given user

schema.description: Retrieve the items for the given user

parameters.name: filter[user-session]
parameters.description: Retrieve the items started from the given browser session

schema.description: Retrieve the items started from the given browser session

parameters.name: filter[status]
parameters.description:
Retrieve the items with the given status

Defaults to retrieve all sessions, including finished ones.

* `active`: Only retrieve active sessions

* `finished`: Only retrieve finished sessions

schema.description:
Retrieve the items with the given status

Defaults to retrieve all sessions, including finished ones.

* `active`: Only retrieve active sessions

* `finished`: Only retrieve finished sessions

get.summary: Get a user by its username (localpart)

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username (localpart) of the user to get

schema.description: The username (localpart) of the user to get

post.summary: Set whether a user can request admin
post.description: Calling this endpoint will not have any effect on existing sessions, meaning that their existing sessions will keep admin access if they were granted it.

Calling this endpoint will lock and deactivate the user, preventing them from doing any action.
This invalidates any existing session, and will ask the homeserver to make them leave all rooms.

Calling this endpoint will lock the user, preventing them from doing any action.
This DOES NOT invalidate any existing session, meaning that all their existing sessions will work again as soon as they get unlocked.

Note that this endpoint ignores any policy which would normally prevent the email from being added.

PaginatedResponse_for_CompatSession.description: A top-level response with a page of resources

SingleResource_for_CompatSession.description: A single resource, with its type, ID, attributes and related links

CompatSession.description: A compatibility session for legacy clients

user_id.description: The ID of the user that owns this session

device_id.description: The Matrix device ID of this session

user_session_id.description: The ID of the user session that started this session, if any

redirect_uri.description: The redirect URI used to login in the client, if it was an SSO login

created_at.description: The time this session was created

user_agent.description: The user agent string that started this session, if any

last_active_at.description: The time this session was last active

last_active_ip.description: The last IP address recorded for this session

finished_at.description: The time this session was finished

self.description: The canonical link to the current resource
The canonical link to the current page

first.description: The link to the first page of results

last.description: The link to the last page of results

next.description:
The link to the next page of results

Only present if there is a next page

prev.description:
The link to the previous page of results

Only present if there is a previous page

ErrorResponse.description: A top-level response with a list of errors

title.description: A human-readable title for the error

PaginatedResponse_for_User.description: A top-level response with a page of resources

SingleResource_for_User.description: A single resource, with its type, ID, attributes and related links

locked_at.description: When the user was locked. If null, the user is not locked.

admin.description: Whether the user can request admin privileges.

username.description: The username of the user to add.

skip_homeserver_check.description:
Skip checking with the homeserver whether the username is available.

Use this with caution! The main reason to use this, is when a user used by an application service needs to exist in MAS to craft special tokens (like with admin access) for them
